word_mean: 痉挛：肌肉或肌群突然不随意地剧烈收缩，伴有疼痛、功能障碍，造成不随意运动和扭歪(嘴、脸、肢体等)
管道或管口突然而短暂的缩窄
局部肌肉拘挛强直的表现，常见于小腿腓肠肌。

sentence.Network_en: A spasm of pain brought his thoughts back to the present.
sentence.Network_cn: 一阵剧痛把他的思绪拉回到了现在。

sentence.Network_en: A muscular spasm in the coronary artery can cause a heart attack.
sentence.Network_cn: 冠状动脉的肌肉痉挛可能导致心脏病。

sentence.Network_en: A lack of magnesium causes muscles to go into spasm.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French spasme, or via Latin from Greek spasmos, spasma, from span 'pull'

entry.def: A spasm is a sudden tightening of your muscles, which you cannot control.

example.ex: A muscular spasm in the coronary artery can cause a heart attack...
example.tran: 冠状动脉的肌肉痉挛可能导致心脏病。

example.ex: A lack of magnesium causes muscles to go into spasm.

entry.tran: (剧痛或不愉快情感的)阵发，迸发
entry.def: A spasm is a sudden strong pain or unpleasant emotion which lasts for a short period of time.

example.ex: A spasm of pain brought his thoughts back to the present...
example.tran: 一阵剧痛把他的思绪拉回到了现在。

example.ex: Kemp felt a spasm of fear.
example.tran: 肯普突然感到一阵恐惧。

means.word_mean: 1. a painful and involuntary muscular contraction
2. (pathology) sudden constriction of a hollow organ (as a blood vessel)

auth_sentence.content: My leg would spasm and jump off the bed.
auth_sentence.res_content: My leg would spasm and jump off the bed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My leg would spasm and jump off the bed.

auth_sentence.content: Her insides contracted in a spasm of disgust.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her insides contracted in a spasm of disgust.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her insides contracted in a spasm of disgust.

auth_sentence.content: Every lurch...sent a spasm of agonizing pain coursing through his body.
auth_sentence.res_content: Every lurch...sent a spasm of agonizing pain coursing through his body.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Every lurch...sent a spasm of agonizing pain coursing through his body.

sentences.en: When the spasm passed, it left him weak and sweating.
sentences.cn: 一阵痉挛之后，他虚弱无力，一直冒汗。

sentences.en: After the patient received acupuncture treatment,his spasms eased off somewhat.
sentences.cn: 病人接受针刺治疗后,痉挛稍微减轻了。

sentences.en: She could not speak; her throat was in spasm.
sentences.cn: 她喉咙抽搐着 ，说不出话来。

sentences.en: If breathing is not restored,the patient may go into spasm.
sentences.cn: 如果不能恢复呼吸,这个病人就会发生抽搐。

sentences.en: If breathing is not restored, the patient may go into spasm.
sentences.cn: 如果不能恢复呼吸, 这个病人就会发生抽搐。

means.word_mean: (能量、行为等的)突发, 发作, 阵发

sentences.en: He felt a spasm of panic sweeping over him.
sentences.cn: 他感到一阵恐慌传遍全身。

sentences.en: He kicked the chair in a spasm of impatience.
sentences.cn: 他突然变得不耐烦，一脚踢向椅子。
